page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: { COOPER DUB-}The pool where the barrel or caskmaker worked. {RAKE-}A narrow mountain path. {RAWES RAKE -}A corruption of Ra's Rake - path leading to the Ra or boundary mark or stone.{NORTH ROW -}Formerly Narrow Way.{WINDGATE -}Corruption of Way in Gate(entry).{COLLIER SYKE -}Small stream or ditch leading to the charcoal burners wood.{KILN HILL. Hill where the clay or brick kilns were.{TOLL BAR. -}Where the road tolls were paid. {SOUTH ING -}Flat riverside grassland lying away from the enclosed land.{PARKER GATE-}Entry to the paddock or enclosed area. {HOWKLASS -}Howe Close - enclosed field on a hill. {BURNS FIELD -Borrans field - pile of stones or mounds.
